source_sentence: 佛說海意菩薩所問淨印法門經
translation: Foshuo haiyi pusa suowen jingying famen jing

source_sentence: 卷第六
translation: Vol. 6

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻臚卿傳
translation: Xitian zhuan jing sanzang朝散 dafu xi hongxian zhuan

source_sentence: 梵大師賜紫沙門臣法護等奉　詔譯
translation: translated by imperial edict from the Sanskrit text given to the purple-colored ascetic ministers Dharmagupta and others

source_sentence: 「◎復次，海意！
translation: *Furthermore, Haiyi!

source_sentence: 若菩薩雖生諸趣，無所希望，善護戒行，即能降蘊魔；
translation: If enlightening beings, though born in various states of existence, have no wishes and are well disciplined, they will be able to subdue the demons of the aggregates.

source_sentence: 若我見無依止善護戒行，能降煩惱魔；
translation: If one were to see self without relying on the precepts, he would be able to subdue the demon of defilement.

source_sentence: 若以淨戒，令諸眾生出離老死，自護戒行能降死魔；
translation: If by means of pure precepts they enable sentient beings to leave the world of old age and death, and if they themselves keep the precepts they will be able to subdue the demon of death.

source_sentence: 若起是念，我令一切毀禁眾生皆悉安住聖淨戒中，自護戒行能降天魔。
translation: If they give rise to this thought, I will cause all sentient beings who violate the precepts to fully abide in the noble and pure precepts, and I will protect myself so that my practice of precepts can subdue the heavenly Māra.

source_sentence: 又復，菩薩於我無所得修行忍辱能降蘊魔；
translation: “Furthermore, enlightening beings cultivate forbearance toward selflessness and are able to subdue the demons of the aggregates.

source_sentence: 於眾生無所得修行忍辱能降煩惱魔；
translation: Cultivating patience and humility ungraspable by sentient beings they can subdue the demons of affliction.

source_sentence: 於生死無所得修行忍辱能降死魔；
translation: Cultivating forbearance without attaining anything in birth and death can subdue the demon of death.

source_sentence: 於涅槃無所得修行忍辱能降天魔。
translation: In nirvāṇa, cultivating forbearance without attaining it can subdue the heavenly Māra.

source_sentence: 又復，菩薩身寂靜故發起精進，能越蘊魔；
translation: “Furthermore, the body of enlightening beings is quiescent, so they undertake vigorous effort and are able to overcome the demons of the aggregates.

source_sentence: 心寂靜故發起精進，能越煩惱魔；
translation: Because their minds are quiescent, they give rise to vigorous effort and can overcome the demon of afflictions.

source_sentence: 了達無生、無起故發起精進，能越死魔；
translation: Because they comprehend nonorigination and nonorigination, they undertake vigorous effort and are able to overcome the demon of death.

source_sentence: 於生死中未甞懈倦，成熟眾生攝受正法發起精進，能越天魔。
translation: They aren't lazy in birth and death, ripen sentient beings to receive the right teaching, initiate effort, and can overcome the Māra of heaven.

source_sentence: 又復，菩薩蘊無依止而修於定，能越蘊魔；
translation: Furthermore, enlightening beings cultivate concentration without relying on the aggregates and are able to overcome the demon of the aggregates.

source_sentence: 界無依止而修於定，能越煩惱魔；
translation: Cultivating concentration without relying on realms, they can overcome the demons of defilement.

source_sentence: 處無依止而修於定，能越死魔；
translation: Cultivating concentration without relying on anything, they can overcome the demon of death.

source_sentence: 於餘禪支，亦悉一一迴向菩提，能越天魔。
translation: In the other branches of meditation, they all turn back to enlightenment one by one and can overcome heavenly Māra.

source_sentence: 又復，菩薩能以正慧善知諸蘊，能降蘊魔；
translation: “Furthermore, enlightening beings can by means of right knowledge know all the aggregates and be able to subdue the demons of the aggregates.

source_sentence: 善知諸界能降煩惱魔；
translation: They know all realms well and can subdue the demons of afflictions.

source_sentence: 善知諸入能降死魔；
translation: They know well that all sense-fields can subdue the demon of death.

source_sentence: 雖善知緣生，而於實際亦不取證，能降天魔。
translation: Even though they well know conditioned arising, they don't really realize it, and they can subdue the demons of heaven.

source_sentence: 又復，菩薩解諸法空，即彼蘊魔伺不得便；
translation: Furthermore, enlightening beings understand the emptiness of all dharmas: that is, the demons of those aggregates are unable to get an advantage over them.

source_sentence: 意能信順諸法無相，即煩惱魔伺不得便；
translation: The mind can believe that all things are signless, but the defiled demons cannot get an advantage over it.

source_sentence: 知一切法無求無願，即彼死魔伺不得便；
translation: Knowing all things are without seeking or wishing, that is, the devils of death cannot get an advantage over them.

source_sentence: 知一切法無所造作，亦無疑惑，然於善行心不厭足，即彼天魔伺不得便。
translation: Knowing all things are not created, they have no doubts or doubts, but their mind isn't satisfied with good actions, which means that the god Māra doesn't get an advantage over them.

source_sentence: 又復，菩薩隨觀身中身念處而修，亦不與身俱起於尋求，能破蘊魔；
translation: “Furthermore, enlightening beings cultivate mindfulness of body in the body according to what they observe. They also do not co-exist with body and give rise to discrimination, which can destroy the demon of aggregates.

source_sentence: 隨觀受中受念處而修，亦不與受俱起於尋求，能破煩惱魔；
translation: He cultivates the state of mindfulness on feelings in accordance with observation of feelings, and does not generate discrimination along with feelings. This can destroy the demon of defilement.

source_sentence: 隨觀心中心念處而修，亦不與心俱起於尋求，能破死魔；
translation: He follows the contemplation of awarenesses as center, and develops them in the state of mindfulness. He also does not give rise to discursive thought together with awarenesses; thus he can destroy the demon of death.

source_sentence: 隨觀法中法念處而修，亦不與法俱起於尋求，於菩提意亦無所動，能破天魔。
translation: He cultivates the mindfulness of principles in contemplation of principles, doesn't seek them together with principles, doesn't move his mind toward enlightenment, and can destroy the demons of heavenly beings.

source_sentence: 「復次，海意！
translation: Furthermore, Hayagrīva!

source_sentence: 汝今當知！
translation: You should now know!

source_sentence: 此如是等諸有魔業，皆由我為根本。
translation: These and other demonic acts of all kinds have the self for their root.

source_sentence: 若或菩薩，於根本我而不起者，即於我無我。
translation: If a bodhisattva doesn't arise from the fundamental self, that means he has no self in himself.

source_sentence: 是中亦無少法可起，如是即以現量智知。
translation: There's also no little thing to give rise to here, which is to say that it's known by direct cognition.

source_sentence: 又若菩薩，為彼無智諸眾生故，被大乘鎧者，菩薩應當不與自他俱時依止故被其鎧。
translation: Also, if a bodhisattva were to be armed with the great vehicle armor for the sake of those ignorant sentient beings, the bodhisattva wouldn't be armed with that armor because he doesn't rely on it at the same time as himself or others.

source_sentence: 菩薩乃自思惟：『我當云何而得此鎧堅固不壞？』
translation: The bodhisattva then thought to himself, 'How will I attain this armor that's strong and indestructible?'

source_sentence: 又復惟忖：『我所被鎧不為壞我，亦不壞眾生，不壞壽者、士夫、養者、補特伽羅、意生等類；
translation: Again, he thought to himself: The armor I am wearing will not harm me. Nor will it harm sentient beings. It will not harm living beings, men, women, beggars, mendicants, and the mentally troubled.

source_sentence: 若或依止我、人、眾生、壽者、補特伽羅等見，即有所著，是故我今諸所依止而悉棄捨。』
translation: If someone relies on views of self, humans, sentient beings, longevity, and pudgala, they'll have attachments; therefore, I now abandon all the things that I rely on.'

source_sentence: 何依止邪？
translation: What is the basis for error?

source_sentence: 謂於蘊、處、界中顛倒依止。
translation: It's a mistaken basis in the aggregates, locations, and realms.

source_sentence: 何所顛倒？
translation: What's the mistake?

source_sentence: 以諸眾生於無常中而生常想；
translation: It is because sentient beings conceive of permanence in the midst of impermanence.

source_sentence: 苦生樂想；
translation: Consciousness of suffering gives rise to perceptions of pleasure.

source_sentence: 無我我想；
translation: selflessness is the idea of self.

source_sentence: 不淨淨想。
translation: The perception of impurity and purity...

source_sentence: 菩薩若能正知彼想，即為如應說其法要。
translation: If a bodhisattva can correctly know their conceptions, then he'll explain the essentials of the teaching as they should be explained.

source_sentence: 云何正知想邪？
translation: What is right knowledge of conceptual identification as wrong?

source_sentence: 謂若無受、無取，即能正知。
translation: It means that if there's no sensation and no apprehension, then he can correctly know.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此若不受彼即不取，此若不取彼亦不受。
translation: If someone doesn't accept this, they won't take it, and if they don't accept this, they won't accept it either.

source_sentence: 若如是者，即無癡昧，能正知想。」
translation: If it's like this, then there's no delusion and the perception of right knowledge.

source_sentence: 海意菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The bodhisattva Haiyi said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 想云何知？
translation: How are conceptions known?

source_sentence: 或過去耶？
translation: Or in the past?

source_sentence: 未來邪？
translation: future evil?

source_sentence: 現在耶？」
translation: Is the present?

source_sentence: 佛言：「非過去、未來、現在。
translation: The Buddha said, Not in the past, future, or present.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 過去想已盡，未來想未至，現在想無住。
translation: The perception of the past has ended, the perception of the future has yet to arrive, and the perception of the present has no abiding.

source_sentence: 是故當知，於三世中想無所得。
translation: Therefore, you should know that conceptions have no attainment in the three times.

source_sentence: 如是乃能正知於想，由正知想故，即能清淨菩薩一切所行之行；
translation: Thus they are able to know conceptions correctly. Because of their knowing conceptions, they are able to purify all the practices carried out by enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 復能了知一切眾生種種之行。
translation: They can also know the various actions of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 海意！
translation: Hayagrīva!

source_sentence: 若菩薩不能清淨菩薩之行，即不能知眾生之行。
translation: If a bodhisattva can't purify the bodhisattva's practice, that means he can't know the practice of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若復能知眾生諸行，乃能清淨菩薩之行。
translation: If someone can also know the actions of sentient beings, they'll be able to purify the bodhisattva's practice.

source_sentence: 如是了知眾生行故，即為眾生如應說法，乃能隨諸眾生心轉，所應示現而悉能知。
translation: Because he thus understands the actions of sentient beings, he explains the teaching to sentient beings as they should be taught, so that he can follow the minds of sentient beings and fully know what should be shown.

source_sentence: 「海意當知！
translation: You should know the meaning of the ocean!

source_sentence: 或有眾生貪意中行瞋，有瞋意中行貪；
translation: “Some sentient beings develop anger in the midst of craving, and some develop greed in the midst of anger.

source_sentence: 有癡意中行瞋，有癡意中行貪；
translation: With delusion, there is hatred; with delusion, there is greed.

source_sentence: 有貪意中行癡，有瞋意中行癡；
translation: There is delusion occurring in the mind of attachment and delusion occurring in the mind of hatred.

source_sentence: 有瞋、癡意中行貪；
translation: In the minds of anger and delusion there is craving.

source_sentence: 有癡、貪意中行瞋。
translation: There's anger in the mind with delusion and craving.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，假現於貪而取於瞋，假現於瞋而取於貪；
translation: Again, some sentient beings falsely show craving and grasp at hatred. Some falsely show anger and grasp at craving.

source_sentence: 假現於瞋而取於癡，假現於癡而取於瞋；
translation: They pretend to show anger and grasp at delusion, while pretend to show delusion and grasp at anger.

source_sentence: 假現於癡而取於貪，假現於貪而取於癡；
translation: They manifest craving in relation to delusion and grasp at it; they manifest craving in relation to delusion and grasp at it.

source_sentence: 假現貪、瞋而取於癡，假現瞋、癡而取於貪；
translation: They manifest craving and hatred in vain to grasp delusion, while they manifest anger and delusion in vain to grasp craving.

source_sentence: 假現癡、貪而取於瞋。
translation: They pretend to be deluded and greedy and grasp anger.

source_sentence: 又有眾生先貪後瞋，先瞋後貪；
translation: Again, some sentient beings are greedy first and angry last, and greedy first and angry last.

source_sentence: 先瞋後癡，先癡後瞋；
translation: The first is hatred, the second is delusion. The first is delusion and the second is hatred.

source_sentence: 先癡後貪，先貪後癡；
translation: The first is delusion and the second is craving. The first is craving and the second is delusion.

source_sentence: 先貪、瞋後癡，先瞋、癡後貪；
translation: The first is greed, and the second is delusion. The first is hatred, and the second is delusion.

source_sentence: 先癡、貪後瞋，先癡、瞋後貪。
translation: The first is delusion, and the second is hatred. The first is delusion, and the second is hatred.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，於色起貪，於聲起瞋；
translation: Again, some sentient beings are greedy with respect to form and angry with respect to sound.

source_sentence: 於聲起貪，於色起瞋；
translation: They give rise to craving regarding sounds and anger regarding form.

source_sentence: 於香起貪，於味起瞋；
translation: They become greedy with respect to smell and angry with respect to taste.

source_sentence: 於味起貪，於香起瞋；
translation: They become greedy with respect to taste and angry with respect to smell.

source_sentence: 於觸起貪，於法起瞋；
translation: They give rise to greed with respect to tangibles and anger with respect to phenomena.

source_sentence: 於法起貪，於觸起瞋。
translation: They give rise to greed for things and anger for touch.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，因離色故而得調伏，不因離聲；
translation: Again, some sentient beings are subdued due to separation from form and not due to separation from sound.

source_sentence: 有離聲故而得調伏，不因離色；
translation: There are those who can be disciplined because of separation from sound, not because of separation from form.

source_sentence: 有離香故而得調伏，不因離味；
translation: Some are subdued because of separation from smell, not because of separation from taste.

source_sentence: 有離味故而得調伏，不因離香；
translation: Some are subdued because of separation from taste, not because of separation from smell.

source_sentence: 有離觸故而得調伏；
translation: There are those who can be disciplined because they are free from touch.

source_sentence: 不因離法；
translation: They do not rely on anything apart from the Teaching.

source_sentence: 有離法故而得調伏，不因離觸。
translation: There are those who can be disciplined because they're free of dharmas and don't cause them to be free of touch.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，因身離故而得調伏，不因心離；
translation: Again, some sentient beings are disciplined due to separation from body but not due to separation from mind.

source_sentence: 因心離故而得調伏，不因身離；
translation: It is because of the mind being disjunctioned that they attain discipline, not because of the body being disjunctioned.

source_sentence: 有亦因身離、亦因心離而得調伏；
translation: There are also those who can be disciplined by means of separation from the body, and those who do so by means of separation from thought.

source_sentence: 有不因身離、不因心離而得調伏。
translation: There's someone who can be disciplined without the body being free of it and without the mind being free of it.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，因無常聲而得調伏，不因苦、無我、寂靜等聲。
translation: Also, there are sentient beings who can be disciplined because of the sound of impermanence and not because of the sounds of suffering, selflessness, quiescence, etc.

source_sentence: 有因苦聲，不因無常、無我、寂靜之聲；
translation: The sound of suffering with cause is not due to the sound of impermanence, selflessness, or quiescence.

source_sentence: 有因無我聲，不因無常、苦、寂靜聲；
translation: The sound of selflessness with cause and not the sound of impermanence, frustration and stillness without cause.

source_sentence: 有因寂靜聲，不因無常、苦、無我之聲。
translation: There's a cause for the sound of quiescence that doesn't arise from the sound of impermanence, suffering, and selflessness.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，有因說法神變而得調伏，不因教誡神變；
translation: Again, some sentient beings are disciplined by means of magical transformations that teach the Dharma but not by magical transformations that instruct.

source_sentence: 有因教誡神變而得調伏，不因說法神變；
translation: There are those who can be disciplined by means of the miraculous power of instructing, not by means of the miraculous power of expounding.

source_sentence: 有因神境神變而得調伏，不因說法、教誡神變。
translation: There are those who attain submission because of the miraculous transformations of spiritual objects and those who don't attain it because of the miraculous transformations of teaching and admonishing.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，因說法神變故而生信解；
translation: Also there were sentient beings who, because of the miraculous power of expounding the Teaching, aroused faith and resolve.

source_sentence: 有因教誡神變故而得遠塵；
translation: There is another cause by which they are able to be far removed from all worldly matter through the supernatural power of instructing.

source_sentence: 有因神境神變故而得解脫。
translation: It's because of the miraculous transformation of the spiritual realm that they attain liberation.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，利根勤行鈍根解脫；
translation: Again, there are sentient beings with keen faculties who diligently practice and are liberated by those with weak faculties.

source_sentence: 有鈍根勤行利根解脫；
translation: Those with weak faculties diligently practice and those with sharp faculties are liberated.

source_sentence: 有鈍根勤行鈍根解脫；
translation: Those with weak faculties diligently practice and those with weak faculties are liberated.

source_sentence: 有利根勤行利根解脫。
translation: He has sharp faculties and diligently practices, and he's liberated by sharp faculties.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，由因得解脫而不由緣；
translation: Again, some sentient beings attain liberation by reason and not by conditions.

source_sentence: 有由緣得解脫而不由因；
translation: There are reasons for attaining liberation, but they do not have causes.

source_sentence: 有亦由因、亦由緣故而得解脫；
translation: Some people also attain liberation by reason of causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 有不由因、不由緣故而得解脫。
translation: There's liberation that doesn't come from causes and doesn't come from conditions.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，因內觀過失故而得解脫，不因外觀；
translation: Also, there are sentient beings who attain liberation by contemplating faults within themselves. They don’t do so because of appearances.

source_sentence: 有因外觀過失而得解脫，不因內觀；
translation: “Some people attain liberation by reason of appearances and faults, not by reason of internal observation.

source_sentence: 有亦因內觀、亦因外觀諸過失故而得解脫；
translation: “Some people also attain liberation by contemplating internally and also by perception of faults.

source_sentence: 有不因內觀、不因外觀諸過失故而得解脫。
translation: There are those who attain liberation because they don't look inside and don't look out for faults.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，修行於樂成證解脫，不因於苦；
translation: Also, there are sentient beings who practice happiness and attain liberation without relying on suffering.

source_sentence: 有因於苦不因於樂；
translation: There is a cause for suffering and no cause for happiness.

source_sentence: 有亦因苦、亦因於樂；
translation: Some dharmas are also the cause of suffering and they are also the cause of pleasure.

source_sentence: 有不因樂亦不因苦。
translation: There are those that don't cause pleasure and those that don't cause suffering.

source_sentence: 又有眾生，因警發相而得調伏；
translation: Again, some sentient beings were disciplined due to the sign of awakening.

source_sentence: 因安止相而得調伏；
translation: They are disciplined by the characteristic of calmness.

source_sentence: 因降伏相而得調伏；
translation: They attain discipline by means of the characteristic of subjugation.

source_sentence: 因善攝相而得調伏；
translation: They are disciplined by means of the characteristics of goodness.

source_sentence: 有因善相而得調伏；
translation: There are those who are disciplined by virtue of their good characteristics.

source_sentence: 有因不善相而得調伏；
translation: There are those who can be disciplined by means of unwholesome characteristics.

source_sentence: 有因瞋相而得調伏；
translation: Some are subdued by the characteristic of hatred.

source_sentence: 有因三相而得調伏；
translation: There are those who are disciplined by the three characteristics.

source_sentence: 有因容緩相而得調伏；
translation: There is a cause by which they are able to be disciplined:

source_sentence: 有因緣生法而得調伏；
translation: They are disciplined by the teachings that arise from causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 有因隨順行而得調伏；
translation: There is a cause by which they are disciplined according to their actions.

source_sentence: 有因默然行而得解脫；
translation: “Some people attain liberation by remaining silent.

source_sentence: 有因差別行而得解脫；
translation: There are reasons for attaining liberation by different practices.

source_sentence: 有因念處法聲，有因正斷聲，有因神足聲，有因根聲，有因力聲，有因覺支聲，
translation: “Sounds of the Teaching in the foundation of mindfulness, sounds of right abandonment, sounds of supernormal powers, sounds of faculties, sounds of powers, sounds of the factors of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 有因正道聲，有因奢摩他聲，有因毘鉢舍那聲，有因四聖諦聲而得解脫。
translation: It's because of the sound of the right path, the sound of quietude, the sound of vipaśyanā, and the sound of the four noble truths that they attain liberation.

source_sentence: 「海意！
translation: Hayagrīva!

source_sentence: 此如是等，不可思議眾生所行，不可思議眾生心意，不可思議眾生境界。
translation: These and so forth are the practices of inconceivable sentient beings, the minds and thoughts of inconceivable sentient beings, and the spheres of inconceivable sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若菩薩入不思議智，入已即能遍入一切眾生不可思議境界。
translation: If a bodhisattva enters inconceivable cognition, and after entering it, he can enter the inconceivable sphere of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 海意！
translation: Hayagrīva!

source_sentence: 譬如有人周遍四方以繩為網，是人忽以因緣入其網中，此人普欲解除其網。
translation: Suppose there's a person who pervades the four directions with a rope as a net, and that person suddenly enters into it for causes and conditions, and this person universally wants to remove its net.

source_sentence: 而以此人善呪力故，其網後時為呪力所加而悉斷壞，是人隨意得出無礙。
translation: Because of the power of this person's good spell, his net will be completely eliminated and destroyed by the power of the spell at a later time, and that person can freely escape without obstruction.

source_sentence: 菩薩亦復如是，由具善巧方便故，遍入一切眾生心意；
translation: Similarly enlightening beings, by means of skill in means, enter the minds and thoughts of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 入已即能以般若波羅蜜多明呪之力，普斷一切眾生煩惱纏縛。
translation: After entering it, he'll be able to use the power of the prajñāpāramitā to explain the spell and cut off the afflictive bonds of all sentient beings with the power of the mantra.

source_sentence: 菩薩然亦不證佛智，普為一切眾生現起施作一切佛事。」
translation: Still, the bodhisattva doesn't realize the Buddha's wisdom and presently perform all buddha-works for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者舍利子前白佛言：「希有世尊！
translation: It was then that Venerable Śāriputra went to the Buddha and said, Rarely, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 所有無量眾生心行，乃至不思議佛智，又復甚奇。
translation: The minds and actions of measureless sentient beings, even the inconceivable Buddha's wisdom, are also marvelous.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若新發意菩薩，或聞說此無量眾生心行、無量佛智，聞已豈非生驚怖邪？」
translation: If a newly awakened bodhisattva or hears this teaching about the mental actions of measureless sentient beings and the knowledge of measureless buddhas, isn't it true that after hearing it, he becomes frightened?

source_sentence: 佛言：「舍利子！
translation: The Buddha said, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 於汝意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 譬如新生師子之子，聞師子吼可驚怖不？」
translation: Suppose a newly born lion's child hears the lion's roar, can he be frightened?

source_sentence: 舍利子言：「不也。
translation: Śāriputra said, No.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 佛言：「舍利子！
translation: The Buddha said, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 新發意菩薩亦復如是，聞佛如來師子吼已，不生驚怖；
translation: The enlightening beings who have newly awakened the aspiration are also like this. Having heard the Buddha, the Enlightened One roar the lion’s roar, they do not become frightened.

source_sentence: 聞說無量眾生心行，亦無恐畏。
translation: They hear and teach the minds and actions of measureless sentient beings, and they have no fear.

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 又如小火光明，於彼一切草木不生驚怖。
translation: It's also like the light of a small fire that doesn't become frightened by all the grass and trees there.

source_sentence: 火亦不作是念：『我無力能燒諸草木。』
translation: Nor does the fire think, 'I'm powerless to burn grass and trees.'

source_sentence: 新發意菩薩亦復如是，智慧光明雖復甚少，而於一切眾生所有煩惱，不生驚怖。
translation: So it is with the newly awakened bodhisattva, who, even though his light of wisdom is very little, doesn't become frightened by the afflictions that all sentient beings have.

source_sentence: 菩薩亦不作是念：『我不能息眾生煩惱。』
translation: Nor does the bodhisattva think, 'I can't stop the afflictions of sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 菩薩若起深固作意，以所成慧如實觀察，即能息諸眾生煩惱。
translation: If a bodhisattva gives rise to profound contemplation and observes it with the wisdom that's cultivated, he'll be able to stop the afflictions of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 又如有火，與彼大地一切草木、樹林、花果，要期盡劫而共鬪戰，至第七日當起戰事。
translation: It's also like a fire that fights with all the grass, trees, forests, flowers, and fruits on the ground for an entire eon until the seventh day when it starts to engage in battle.

source_sentence: 時彼大地草木，并餘一切草木等眾而共集會，乃相謂言：『汝有力能，
translation: The trees and shrubs on the ground, as well as all the other kinds of grasses and trees, assembled together. They said to each other:

source_sentence: 與我援助。』
translation: Give me help.'

source_sentence: 時諸草木積聚既廣量等須彌，時或有人來謂火言：『草木眾多，汝唯單己。
translation: When the amount of grass and trees there was as large as Mount Sumeru, some people might come and say to the fire, 'There's plenty of grass and trees, but you're alone.

source_sentence: 汝今何不多求援助？
translation: Why don't you ask for help now?

source_sentence: 汝力何能敵草木眾？』
translation: How can you oppose the grass and trees with your strength?'

source_sentence: 彼火答言：『我今不須求其助力。
translation: The fire answered, 'Now, I don't need to ask for their help.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 而諸草木雖復眾多，隨彼一切我力能敵，令彼草木悉滅無餘。』
translation: Even though there are so many plants and trees, they can oppose them according to the power of their own strength and cause all those plants and trees to cease without remainder.'

source_sentence: 菩薩亦復如是，隨彼無量眾生一切煩惱，菩薩即放無量慧火，其力敵勝。
translation: Similarly, the bodhisattva follows all the afflictions of measureless sentient beings, and the bodhisattva then releases the fire of measureless wisdom, which is so powerful that it's superior.

source_sentence: 又復菩薩起深固意，於一切眾生煩惱聚中，以所成慧如實觀察，即能息諸眾生煩惱。
translation: Again, the bodhisattva arouses a profound intention to truly observe the accumulation of afflictions in all sentient beings with the wisdom he attains so that he can stop the afflictions of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若或菩薩取證離煩惱法，捨煩惱者，彼即速墮聲聞、緣覺之地。
translation: If a bodhisattva apprehends and realizes the principle of freedom from affliction and abandons affliction, he'll quickly fall into the stages of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 以是緣故，汝應當知！
translation: Because of these reasons, you should know!

source_sentence: 若菩薩隨於一切煩惱聚中，能深固作意如實伺察者，即於彼彼一切煩惱力能勝伏。
translation: If a bodhisattva follows all the clusters of afflictions and can deeply contemplate and truly investigate them, then the power of all those afflictions will be able to overcome them.

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 若有得聞如是說已不驚怖者，當知是為善巧方便菩薩。
translation: If someone hears such a teaching and isn't frightened, they should be known to be a bodhisattva who skillfully uses skillful means.

source_sentence: 「舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 又如蛇毒，凡所傷[口*赦]而無助伴。
translation: It's also like the poison of a snake, which has no accompanying [mouth*forgiveness] for whatever it hurts.

source_sentence: 新發意菩薩亦復如是，修集菩提分法時，亦復單己而無助伴，但自修集菩提分法。
translation: So it is with the newly awakened bodhisattva who cultivates the factors of enlightenment, and when he cultivates the factors of enlightenment, he also cultivates the factors of enlightenment by himself alone without any companions.

source_sentence: 又如螢火，不能勝彼百千日輪廣大光明。
translation: It's also like a firefly, which can't outshine the vast radiance of that hundred thousand suns.

source_sentence: 一切煩惱亦復如是，不能勝敵菩薩慧光。
translation: So it is with all the afflictions, which can't overcome the enemy bodhisattva's wisdom and light.

source_sentence: 又如除毒之藥，狀雖至小，而能解除廣大之毒。
translation: It's also like a medicine that removes poison, which although small in shape is able to remove the vast poison.

source_sentence: 菩薩亦復如是，智慧之藥雖復至小，而能息除諸煩惱毒。
translation: So it is with the bodhisattva: even though the medicine of wisdom may be small, it can still extinguish the poison of afflictions.

source_sentence: 又如天降一味之雨，隨所墮處，器有差別成種種味。
translation: It's also like when the gods send down a single flavor of rain, and there are distinctions in the containers that create various flavors wherever they fall.

source_sentence: 菩薩亦復如是，修集一味解脫之智，隨諸眾生種種根性，種種說法而各有異。
translation: Similarly, bodhisattvas cultivate the knowledge of the single flavor of liberation, which varies according to the various faculties and natures of sentient beings as they teach differently.

source_sentence: 又如閻浮檀金出現世間，映蔽一切餘諸珍寶。
translation: It's also like the Jambudvīpa gold that appears in the world and reflects all the other treasures.

source_sentence: 菩薩大寶出現世間亦復如是，映蔽一切聲聞、緣覺。
translation: So it is with the appearance of the great treasure bodhisattva in the world, which eclipses all śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

source_sentence: 又如轉輪聖王出現世間，一切小王皆悉歸向。
translation: It's also like when a wheel-turning sage king appears in the world and all the lesser kings return to them.

source_sentence: 菩薩法王之子亦復如是，若發大菩提心，一切世間天、人、阿修羅等，
translation: So it is with the enlightening being Universally Good: if he decides to give rise to great determination for enlightenment, all the gods, humans, and asuras of the world will be likewise.

source_sentence: 各各頂奉而悉歸向。
translation: Each of them bowed their heads and all returned to him.

source_sentence: 又如薄福眾生，雖遇寶雨而無所獲；
translation: It is also like the case of poorly endowed sentient beings who, even though they encounter a precious rain, do not obtain anything.

source_sentence: 不種善根諸眾生等亦復如是，雖發菩提心而無所成。
translation: So it is with sentient beings who don't plant good roots and so forth, even though they give rise to the mind of enlightenment, but nothing is accomplished.

source_sentence: 又如世間若無甘蔗種子，即不能生於甜味。
translation: Also, if there were no sugarcane seeds in the world, they wouldn't give rise to sweet taste.

source_sentence: 菩薩亦復如是，若無大菩提心種子，即不能成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果。」
translation: Similarly, if there are no seeds of the great mind of enlightenment, bodhisattvas won't be able to achieve the fruit of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 佛說海意菩薩所問淨印法門經卷第六
translation: Foshuo haiyi pusa suowen jingying famu jing jing
